item.title: [FLINK-3072] DbStateBackendTest

Tests in error: 
  DbStateBackendTest.testCaching:301 Â» SQLNonTransientConnection java.net.Connec...
  DbStateBackendTest.testCompaction:242 Â» SQLNonTransientConnection java.net.Con...
  DbStateBackendTest.testSetupAndSerialization:105 Â» SQLNonTransientConnection j...
The SQLNonTransientConnectionException killed one of my builds as well.
This is weird, I haven't had this on any of my travis builds, and I have been building this for a while...

It seems like the derby server does not start properly by the @BeforeClass method by the time the test methods start executing.

The problem seems to be that server.start() is an async call that spawns a new thread. So I need to make sure to block in the setup method and wait for the server to start.

GitHub user gyfora opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1401

FLINK-3072 [streaming] Ensure Derby server starts before running any tests

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/gyfora/flink master

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1401.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1401

commit 40f7e39b90c51ed193ecfb1ed85a675918e2ae01
Author: Gyula Fora <gyfora@apache.org>
Date: 2015-11-24T16:30:12Z

FLINK-3072 [streaming] Ensure Derby server starts before running any tests

Github user StephanEwen commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1401#issuecomment-159586011

Looks good, +1

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1401
Thanks for the quick fix gyfora!
No problem

Happened again. Yes, I did rebase to current master https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/94500748/log.txt
